sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The UK's King Charles has been diagnosed with a form of cancer and has begun treatment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Less than 18 months into his reign, the 75-year-old monarch will suspend his public duties, but will continue as head of state and carry on with his constitutional roles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The palace didn't say what form of cancer the king has, but confirmed that it's not related to his recent treatment for a benign prostate condition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It added that the king was remaining positive and chose to share his diagnosis to help with public understanding and for all those around the world affected by cancer. Charles became king in September 2022 when his mother Queen Elizabeth II died at the age of 96. His son Prince Harry will travel to the UK from California in the coming days to see him. sentences.sentence: Les États-Unis plancent plus de bruits au Moyen-Orient contre les groupes d'arriées d'Iran, selon les parlementaires du Conseil national de sécurité. The U.S. plans more strikes in the Middle East against Iran-backed groups, according to its National Security Council spokesman.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: But analysts say Washington is treading a diplomatic tightrope. European member states could step up military support to Ukraine by delaying and diverting

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Ukraine is grappling with obstacles on many fronts, including a diminishing supply of missiles, artillery and other weapons on the battlefield. It comes as renewed Russian airstrikes in January caused a huge upsurge in civilian casualties and destruction across the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The quickest and cheapest and more effective way of increasing our supply of ammunition to Ukraine is to stop exporting to third countries. And this is something that only member states can do.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Francesco Giorgi, one of the defendants in a corruption scandal that rocked the European Parliament, has brought new evidence to try to bring down the trial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It is a recorded conversation, to which Euronews has been given access, in which the chief investigator questions the credibility of the most prominent repentant in the case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Referring to former MEP Antonio Panzeri, the suspected ringleader who struck a deal to collaborate with investigators, the policeman says says. Don't think that because he says things and we believe him, we don't believe anything he says.

sentences.sentence: We don't believe anything he says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We know very well that he's putting us on the boat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We know it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But all of this is going to blow up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: When it blows up, it will blow up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And he will take his responsibilities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And I know that he's going to win.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The conversation was secretly recorded by Giorgi, who is a defendant along with his partner Eva Kaili, on his mobile phone when the senior policeman visited his home last May.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: During the exchange, the policeman also complains about the role of the judges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I have no confidence in the European Union and I have no confidence in the European officials. None. And the more time passes, the more I feel right.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The audio file is part of the evidence that Giorgi's defence has produced in an upteenth effort to bring down the trial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Six people remain indicted and await trial on charges of accepting bribes to defend the interests of countries such as Qatar and Morocco.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Both countries deny the allegations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: This Tuesday marks one year since the devastating earthquake in Turkey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Many of the 700,000 left homeless by the earthquake are still living in tents.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In Antioch, the hardest hit city, 90% of its buildings were destroyed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Survivors are still waiting for the help promised by government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Some residents were rehomed in shipping containers and others in tents despite freezing temperatures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Eight members of his family also live here.

sentences.sentence: Turkish authorities want to start reconstruction efforts by rebuilding businesses to kickstart the economy. But this time anti-seismic standards will be respected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: affordable rental flats available. One of the candidates is Andreas. As a teenager in Vienna he slipped straight from his parents' house into homelessness.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: My father woke me up the next day and said we were being evicted. I was 18 when I arrived früher aufgewacht und gesagt, wir werden delogiert. Dementsprechend bin ich halt mit 18 dann auch da gestanden und habe nicht gewusst, die ganze Welt bricht zusammen, die ganzen Freunde wenden sich von einem ab, weil man plötzlich irgendwie quasi Abschaum ist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Für sechs Jahre hat sein Leben um unabhängige Schelter und Drogenverletzungen geflogen.

sentences.sentence: Im vergangenen Jahrzehnt ist die Zahl der Obdachlosen in Europa massiv gestiegen.

Ich glaube, man kann sich nicht ganz vorstellen, was heißt Obdachlosigkeit wirklich.
